result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason D. Kruger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason D. Kruger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason D. Kruger was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

9:46 am - Court calls case and DA states appearances.  Defendant Jason D. Kruger appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This is a motion hearing to enter JOC.  DA state's that DE has not completed batterers group, nor paid restitution.  Comments by DE. Court questions DE.  Comments by DA.  DA asks that the DE stipulate that deferred agreement be extended and the DE is to contact additional provider to provide batterers service.  DE to increase restitution payment to $50 per month beginning 3/6/18 and each month thereafter.  Court adopts DA's suggestion.  DE is to provide proof of contact with another batterers group within 30 days of today to COC and DA's office.

10:00 am - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Jason D. Kruger in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states facts of case, regarding warrant being issued for non appearance, and agreement reached in this case.    DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Ct 2.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders deferred entry of JOC on Ct 2, and on motion of DA, dismisses Ct 1.  Court imposes:

Ct 2 - deferred 1 year.
See written order.

1:35pm Attorney James Richard Lex appeared. DE Not in Court.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states case and appearances.  Court questions Atty. Lex.  Court orders Warrant $500.00 + $50.00 process fee.  Warrant is to be placed on hold until 10/4/16 at 10:00am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 30, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Jason D. Kruger appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue.

DE does not appear. Attorney James Richard Lex appeared.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Comments by Attorney Lex regarding  DE's non-appearance and authorization to appear and requests adjournment. So ordered. Set for 05-31-16 @ 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

3:15 pm - Plaintiff, District Attorney Mark T. Fuhr, in person. Defendant, in person, in custody. Amy Kruger appears by telephone. DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges.  DE next court date is 05-24-16 at 10 am.  Court gives DE a notice of right to attorney and victim witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
